attribute.description: This code defines the packaging levels of a product code. Typically there are three levels (each, box, case), but a franchise is not limited to three. The number of levels (or UOM records) and the description of the levels per product code is determined by the franchise.
Indicates if the variant has the default UOM for the product.
Defines if the UOM is the shipping unit of measure or not.
This field contains the UOM code associated with the physical measurements (height, width and depth)
This field contains the physical depth measurement associated with the Linear UOM Code.
This field contains the physical height measurement associated with the Linear UOM Code.
This field contains the physical width measurement associated with the Width UOM Code.
This field contains the UOM code associated with the physical volume measurement.
This field contains UOM Code associated with the weight measurement.
This field contains the physical volume measurement associated with the Volume UOM Code.
Gross Weight is the total weight of something, when combined with something else.
Numerator used with Denominator for calculations.
This code defines the packaging levels of a product code.
This is used to indicate in which regions for which the UOM is applicable.
The number of eaches (as defined by packaging level 1) in this packaging level.
This will be the 'label' applied to the lower packaging level.
Non-formatted UPC code - Each = UPC, Case = Outer Case Code.
The net weight of an object disregards the weight (mass) of any element not intrinsic to the object itself.
The Value coprresponds to EAN_UPC_NF from STG_PRODUCT_UNIT source stage table.
